SENTENCE.STRING: (Turkish: Türkiye), officially the Republic of Turkey (Türkiye Cumhuriyeti), is a Eurasian country that stretches across the Anatolian peninsula in Southwestern Asia and the Balkan region of Southeastern Europe.

borders eight countries: Bulgaria to the northwest; Greece to the west; Georgia to the northeast; Armenia, Iran and the Nakhichevan exclave of Azerbaijan to the east; and Iraq and Syria to southeast asia.
borders the Black Sea to the north; the Aegean Sea and the Sea of Marmara to the west; and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
is a democratic, secular, constitutional republic
political system was established in 1923 after the fall of the Ottoman Empire under the leadership of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk.
is a founding member of the United Nations, the OIC, the OECD and the OSCE, a member state of the Council of Europe since 1949 and of the NATO since 1952, and
is currently in accession negotiations with the European Union, being an associate member since 1964..
strategic location straddling Europe and Asia,
has been a historical crossroad between eastern and western cultures.
